title: South Korea Protests ICE Raid at Hyundai Plant, 475 Arrested
snippets: "The business activities of our investors and the rights of our nationals must not be unjustly infringed," a foreign ministry spokesman said after about 300 South Koreans were detained.
Many of the 475 arrested were from South Korea, leading the country to call the raid an unjust infringement of people's rights.
Seoul demands protection for nationals, investors as Trump's immigration crackdown sees hundreds detained in ICE raid.
U.S. immigration authorities detained hundreds a Georgia-based Hyundai plant, a majority of which were South Korean nationals.
titles: Hundreds of South Koreans are among 475 detained in a Georgia immigration raid
South Koreans detained in immigration raid at Hyundai electric vehicle site in US
South Korea objects as US immigration raids Hyundai plant
Homeland Security Detained 475 People In Immigration Raid At Hyundai Plant—As South Korea Raises Concern
summary: In a recent ICE raid at a Georgia-based Hyundai plant, approximately 475 individuals were arrested, with a significant number being South Korean nationals. This action prompted South Korea to demand protection for its nationals and investors, labeling the raid as an unjust infringement of rights. The foreign ministry emphasized the importance of not unjustly infringing on the business activities and rights of their nationals.

title: Angela Rayner Resigns After Ethics Breach, Shaking Starmer's Leadership
snippets: Her departure comes after the PM's ethics adviser concludes that she breached ministerial rules.
The Prime Minister refuses to say if he’ll sack his deputy, if she broke the rules.
Move plunges Keir Starmer’s administration into turmoil

This decision comes amid Keir Starmer's refusal to discuss her potential dismissal and has led to turmoil within his administration. Rayner's resignation is seen as a significant setback for Starmer, who had previously supported her.

title: Israeli Forces Seize 40% of Gaza City, Escalate Crisis with Tower Demolition
snippets: The images come as the Israeli military says it has established control over 40% of Gaza City.
The 'gates of hell are opening' in Gaza, says Israeli defence minister as attacks cause panic and fear among civilians.
Israeli forces attacked and destroyed the 12-storey Mushtaha tower in Gaza City on Friday.

The Israeli military destroyed a landmark building after saying it had taken control of almost half of the city, where hundreds of thousands of civilians are sheltering amid a worsening humanitarian crisis.
titles: Israel destroys dozens of buildings in Gaza City as new offensive intensifies

summary: The Israeli military has taken control of approximately 40% of Gaza City, escalating tensions and causing widespread panic among civilians. The Israeli Defence Minister described the situation as "the gates of hell are opening" in Gaza. In a significant move, Israeli forces demolished the 12-storey Mushtaha tower in Gaza City. This action is part of a broader offensive that has seen the destruction of key infrastructure, leading to a severe humanitarian crisis for the city's residents.

title: 16 Killed in Lisbon Funicular Derailment; Mechanical Fault Suspected
snippets: Authorities have confirmed three Brits are among 16 people who were killed in Wednesday's accident.

Portuguese investigators find no evidence of sabotage, with mechanical or maintenance issues among possible causes

  • ‘Someone needs to answ
Images of recovery efforts in the accident, which killed 16 people on Wednesday, appeared to show damage to a cable connecting the funicular’s two cars.

Police say two Canadians are among the 16 dead in Lisbon after a funicular derailed in the Portuguese capital on Wednesday, The Associated Press reports. The dead also included five Portuguese nationals, three British citizens, two South Koreans, one American, one French, one Swiss and one Ukrainian
titles: Three British nationals among 16 killed in Lisbon crash
Three Britons among 16 people killed in Lisbon funicular crash, police confirm
Questions Focus on Cable in Lisbon Funicular Crash
Portuguese police confirm two Canadians dead in Lisbon funicular crash
summary: Sixteen people, including three Brits, two Canadians, five Portuguese, two South Koreans, one American, one French, one Swiss, and one Ukrainian, were killed in a funicular derailment in Lisbon. Portuguese investigators have ruled out sabotage, focusing on mechanical or maintenance issues as the likely cause. Recovery efforts have highlighted damage to a cable connecting the funicular's cars.

title: Trump to Sign Order Renaming Defense Department to Department of War
snippets: The US president has sought to refocus the department on "warfighting" and a "warrior ethos".

US President Donald Trump is set to sign an executive order to change the name of the Department of Defense to the "Department of War." This would revive a name that was abandoned over seven decades ago.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMid0FVX3lxTE5ENDJYTUxaT3Y3VXNfdWxGXzM0VlF0dnlubDdzbGtXTi1VWlVSdmtKYl9TV3o3WGpXc0JUOXozV2c4VWFZbDhYY3pUeHYyYW01Z3RzeUVMNk04MkJ3Ni1obkhGOWtCS3ZCekpZVEdwd0U3XzZTQVIw?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump seeks to rename Department of Defense to Department of War</a

titles: Trump seeks to rebrand Department of Defense as Department of War
US: Trump to relabel Pentagon as 'Department of War'
Trump seeks to rename Department of Defense to Department of War - Axios
Trump Will Rename Defense Department To ‘Department Of War’ Today—Is It Legal? Here’s What To Know.
summary: President Trump plans to sign an executive order renaming the Department of Defense to the Department of War, emphasizing a focus on "warfighting" and a "warrior ethos." The change, which can be used in official correspondence and ceremonial contexts, requires Congressional approval for full implementation.

title: Russia Threatens Western Troops in Ukraine as "Legitimate Targets"
snippets: The Russian leader's refusal comes after 26 countries pledged to deploy troops to Ukraine in the event of a ceasefire.

The Kremlin views any Western military deployment in Ukraine as a threat and would regard them as "legitimate targets for destruction." Meanwhile, Ukraine has struck a Russian oil refinery overnight. DW has more.

Russian president’s threat follows French proposal for post-war support for Kyiv that includes presence of Nato countries’ forces

Vladimir Putin has said any western troops placed in Ukraine would be “legitimate targets” for Russian strikes, upping the stakes as Kyiv’s allies scramble to co

Macron says 26 nations have offered security guarantees for Ukraine as Zelenskyy meets Slovakia’s Fico amid tension over Russian energy supplies

  • Ma
The Russian leader made the threat a day after European leaders said they were willing to deploy forces on the ground to secure an agreement to end the war.
titles: Putin rejects Western security in Ukraine, warning troops would be target
Putin: Western troops in Ukraine are 'legitimate targets'
Western troops in Ukraine would be ‘legitimate targets’, Putin says

Western Troops in Ukraine Before a Peace Deal Would Be ‘Targets’, Putin Says
summary: The Russian president has declared that any Western troops deployed in Ukraine, following a proposal involving 26 nations offering security guarantees to Kyiv, would be considered "legitimate targets" by Russia. This statement escalates tensions as it comes after European leaders expressed willingness to send forces to Ukraine to help secure a ceasefire. Concurrently, Ukraine has conducted an attack on a Russian oil refinery.

title: U.S. Job Growth Slows in August, Unemployment Rises to 4.3%
snippets: The U.S. job market showed more signs of weakness Friday, as the Labor Department reported just 22,000 jobs added in August. Revised figures show the economy lost jobs in June, and the unemployment rate inched up to 4.3%.
U.S. economy adds only 22,000 jobs as labor market stalls
Lower than expected figure opens door to aggressive Federal Reserve rate cuts
titles: The U.S. added only 22,000 jobs last month, showing cracks in the labor market
U.S. economy adds only 22,000 jobs as labor market stalls - Axios
US adds just 22,000 jobs in August as labour market sputters
summary: In August, the U.S. job market showed signs of weakening, with only 22,000 jobs added, below expectations. The Labor Department also revised June's figures, indicating job losses, and reported the unemployment rate rose to 4.3%. This development may lead to more aggressive Federal Reserve rate cuts.

title: Anisimova to Face Sabalenka in US Open Final After Defeating Osaka
snippets: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka will face Amanda Anisimova in the U.S. Open women's final.
Amanda Anisimova made it through to consecutive Grand Slam finals and a shot at ultimate redemption with a showdown against defending US Open champion Aryna Sabalenka.
Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka was simply too good for Jessica Pegula yet again, winning their U.S. Open semifinal 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 on Thursday night in a rematch of last year’s final.
titles: Anisimova wins, sets up Open final vs. Sabalenka
Anisimova sets up US Open final against defending champion Sabalenka
Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka to face Amada Anisimova in US Open final
summary: Amanda Anisimova defeated Naomi Osaka in a tense, three-set match to reach the U.S. Open women's final, where she will face defending champion Aryna Sabalenka. Sabalenka secured her spot in the final by beating Jessica Pegula. Both Anisimova and Sabalenka have shown strong performances after taking mental health breaks, with Anisimova aiming for her first US Open title against the reigning champion.

title: Tesla Unveils $1T Potential Compensation Plan for Musk, Targets $8.5T Valuation
snippets:
CEO will have to increase the value of his electric car company from just over $1tn to $8.5tn over 10 years

  • Business li
The pay package is unprecedented in both its size and the scale at which Tesla would have to grow for Elon Musk to achieve it.

Tesla has proposed a new 10-year compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk that could be worth as much as $1 trillion even as the EV maker's car business stumbles and it sets its sights on humanoid robotics and AI.
titles: Tesla offers Elon Musk a trillion-dollar pay package

Tesla proposes new pay package for Elon Musk worth up to $1T
summary: Tesla has introduced a new 10-year compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk, potentially worth up to $1 trillion. This plan requires Musk to increase Tesla's value from just over $1tn to $8.5tn. The proposal is notable for its ambitious growth target and the significant potential payout, amidst Tesla's focus on expanding into humanoid robotics and AI, despite challenges in its electric vehicle business.

title: US Unemployment Rises to 4.3%, Job Growth Slows Amid Trade War
snippets: The job market in the United States showed another sign of cooling amid the ongoing trade war as unemployment ticked up in August to 4.3 per cent.
The US added far fewer jobs in August than the expected gain of 75,000, while unemployment increased to 4.3%.
titles: The U.S. job market stalled in August with unemployment ticking up to 4.3%
Job growth badly missed expectations in August, and unemployment ticked up
summary: In August, the US job market displayed signs of slowing, with unemployment rising to 4.3% and job additions falling below the expected 75,000. This development occurs amidst an ongoing trade war.

title: Elon Musk Eyes $1 Trillion Payout if Tesla Grows by $7.5 Trillion in 10 Years
snippets: Elon Musk, already the world's richest person, is in line for a payout of US$1 trillion if his electric car company meets a series of targets over the next 10 years.
Tesla proposes a $1 trillion pay package for Elon Musk, if can stay focused on adding $7.5 trillion to the company’s value.
titles: Elon Musk may become the world’s 1st trillionaire
Here’s what Elon Musk must do to become a Tesla trillionaire
summary: Elon Musk could receive a $1 trillion payout from Tesla if the company's value increases by $7.5 trillion over the next 10 years. This proposed pay package is contingent on Musk meeting specific targets aimed at significantly boosting Tesla's market value.

title: EU Fines Google €2.95 Billion for Ad Service Bias, Google to Appeal
snippets: The search engine giant was slapped a €2.95 billion fine over favoring its own advertising services. Google said it will appeal.

LONDON (AP) — European Union regulators on Friday hit Google with a 2.95 billion euro ($3.5 billion) fine for breaching the bloc’s competition rules by favoring its own digital advertising services, marking the fourth such antitrust penalty for the company as well as a retreat from previ
titles: European Commission fines Google in ad-tech antitrust case
Google hit with $3.5 billion fine from European Union in ad-tech antitrust case
summary: The European Union fined Google €2.95 billion for favoring its own advertising services, violating competition rules. This marks Google's fourth antitrust penalty from the EU. Google plans to appeal the decision.

titles: Tesla's nearly $1 trillion new pay plan for Musk would expand his voting power

title: UN: Wildfires Impact Air Quality Globally, Link to Climate Change
snippets: Wildfires are releasing a risky mix of pollutants that can end up damaging air quality, according to a report from the UN weather agency. It said that air quality and climate change are closely connected.
Wildfires are releasing a "witches' brew" of pollutants that can end up wrecking air quality a continent away from the blaze, the UN's weather and climate agency said Friday.
titles: Wildfires fuel air pollution, says UN report
Wildfires producing 'witches' brew' of air pollution: UN
summary: Wildfires emit a dangerous mix of pollutants, affecting air quality far beyond their origin, as reported by the UN weather agency. This contributes to the linkage between air quality and climate change, highlighting the global impact of such fires.

title: Waymo Expands to Austin and Atlanta, Adds California Airport Rides
snippets: Waymo has launched commercial operations in Austin, Texas, as well as Atlanta, San Francisco, Phoenix and Los Angeles.

summary: Waymo has expanded its commercial operations to Austin, Texas, and Atlanta, joining San Francisco, Phoenix, and Los Angeles. This includes offering rides to and from the first airport in California, building on nearly two years of operations at the Phoenix airport.
